meanings.definition: Full of or involving chance or risk.
meanings.sent1: The game was very chanceful, with players taking risks at every turn.
meanings.sent2: The journey through the dense forest was quite chanceful, as we encountered unexpected obstacles.
meanings.sent3: The chanceful weather made the outdoor wedding ceremony more exciting.
meanings.sent4: Life is a chanceful adventure, full of unexpected twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The chanceful decision to invest in the new company paid off handsomely.

meanings.sent1: The meeting was chanceful, as I bumped into my old friend unexpectedly.
meanings.sent2: The discovery of the rare flower in the garden was purely chanceful.
meanings.sent3: It was chanceful that we both chose the same restaurant for lunch.
meanings.sent4: In the chanceful encounter, they found a shared love for hiking.
meanings.sent5: The chanceful meeting led to a serendipitous collaboration between the artists.
